comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Not quite sure where this pic was taken...a couple of the Teviot Range peaks can be seen in the distance...so it's in SE Qld...work in progress

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content:
Ha! I've just this week dispatched a couple of experts from out Moggill way on what I now realise is a goose chase! My apologies experts! ...I initially thought this pic might have been taken opposite the junction of the Brisbane and Bremer Rivers...but the more I looked (via various pics on Flickr, Google street view, etc) the more I realised things didn't stack up...and the Teviot Range doesn't quite have this profile from out that way either...I feel like a complete goose!

...anyway, after further digging around...I've discovered that this is a companion to another Poulsen pic titled 'SB Cemetery & Fairfield', which also happens to be in the ANMM collection...though not yet on Flickr...With so much water around, apart from the Teviot Range peaks, which we see on the horizon, I can't make head nor tail of what we see here...I can't tell river from flood water, let alone find any familiar landmarks...I thought I might be able to walk around Highate Hill and Dutton Park and with a bit of luck find the spot where this pic was taken...but 120 years on, I've discovered this mightn't possible...I haven't completely given up hope, but during my first excursion I found there are way too many houses and trees around which block the view...regardless, it would be good to have the companion Poulson pic also up on Flickr if that were possible...it shows the view next frame to the left.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] No problem! Thanks for all the info Quasymody :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Thanks for putting up the companion pic!...with the companion pic now in higher resolution I have a better sense of the location...I'm far from 100% certain, but I suspect both pics were taken from Gladstone Rd, not far from where the Green Bridge now crosses the Brisbane River...next fine day when I have a spare half hour I'll see if I can get a decent pic from somewhere nearby...watch this space!


In this pic we're looking S/W, upstream across what I gather are the flooded low lying parts of of St Lucia ...then mainly farmland...now the University of Queensland.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] No problems, you're bringing in so much info on these Poulsen pics! Thx
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
